events.originalText: At least 151 people were killed when heavy rains triggered a landslide in the village of Malin in Maharashtra, India.
events.subtitle: 2014 Malin landslide
events.headline: 151 killed in landslide in Malin, India

events.originalText: A train fire kills 32 passengers and injures 27 on the Tamil Nadu Express in Andhra Pradesh, India.
events.subtitle: Nellore train fire
events.headline: 32 dead in train fire on Tamil Nadu Express

events.originalText: Lebanon War: The Israeli Air Force attacked a three-story building near the Lebanese village of Qana, killing at least 28 civilians, including 16 children.
events.subtitle: 2006 Lebanon War
events.headline: Israeli Air Force kills 28 civilians in Lebanon War

events.originalText: Ian Gow, Conservative Member of Parliament, is assassinated at his home by the IRA in a car bombing.
events.subtitle: Ian Gow
events.headline: Conservative MP Ian Gow assassinated by IRA

events.originalText: Amid a widespread economic crisis and food shortages in Poland, up to 50,000 people, mostly women and children, took part in the largest of nationwide hunger demonstrations in Łódź.
events.subtitle: 1981 Polish hunger demonstrations
events.headline: 50,000 protest food shortages in Poland

events.originalText: American labor-union leader Jimmy Hoffa disappeared after last being seen outside a restaurant near Detroit.
events.subtitle: Jimmy Hoffa
events.headline: Jimmy Hoffa disappears near Detroit

events.originalText: At the height of a political crisis known as the royal question, four workers were shot dead by the Belgian Gendarmerie at a strike in Grâce-Berleur.
events.subtitle: Royal question
events.headline: 4 workers shot dead in Belgian strike

events.originalText: In Montevideo, the Uruguay national football team won the first FIFA World Cup.
events.subtitle: Montevideo
events.headline: Uruguay wins first FIFA World Cup

events.originalText: World War I: German agents sabotaged U.S.-made munitions in New York Harbor that were to be supplied to the Allies.
events.subtitle: World War I
events.headline: German agents sabotage U.S. munitions in New York Harbor

events.originalText: The Staten Island Ferry Westfield's boiler explodes, killing over 45 people.
events.subtitle: Staten Island Ferry
events.headline: 45 killed in Staten Island Ferry explosion

events.originalText: Off the coast of Crescent City, California, the steamer Brother Jonathan (depicted) struck an uncharted rock and sank, killing 225 people; its cargo of gold coins was not retrieved until 1996.
events.subtitle: Crescent City, California
events.headline: 225 die as steamer sinks off Crescent City, California

events.originalText: Miguel Hidalgo y Costilla, leader of the Mexican War of Independence, was executed by Spanish forces in Chihuahua City, Mexico.
events.subtitle: Miguel Hidalgo y Costilla
events.headline: Mexican independence leader Hidalgo executed in Chihuahua City
